0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Hypochloremia: specific dosage dependent on the condition and tolerance of the patient; administer IV at a rate not to exceed 5 mL/min

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• Severe renal impairment
  • Severely reduced liver function
  • Metabolic alkalosis due to vomiting of hydrochloric acid accompanied by sodium loss (excretion of sodium bicarbonate in the urine)

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Ammonia toxicity may occur; observe constantly for signs and symptoms of toxicity (pallor, sweating, retching, irregular breathing, bradycardia, cardiac arrhythmias, local and general twitching, tonic convulsions and coma)
  • Primary respiratory acidosis with high total carbon dioxide and buffer base
  • Rapid IV administration; local irritation and toxic effects may occur; IV administration should be slow

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • must dilute prior to administration; dilute 1 to 2 vials (100 mEq to 200 mEq) in 500 mL to 1000 mL of NS; diluted concentration should not exceed 1% to 2%
  • rate of infusion should not exceed 5 mL/min
